Uses of Package
parallel

  • Packages that use parallel 
    Package Description
    analysis
    analysis package: a package implementing parallel algorithms for numerical differentiation and integration, and also including more complex transformations such as convolution.
    graph
    graph package: a collection of classes for representing graphs, hyper-graphs and algorithms operating on such discrete finite structures.
    graph.coarsening
    package defines abstract classes and implements algorithms for coarsening graphs.
    graph.packing
    Optimization package that obtains near-optimal solution to the 1- and 2-packing combinatorial optimization problem.
    graph.partitioning
    Package defines interfaces and implements algorithms for graph and hyper-graph partitioning.
    parallel
    parallel package: an implementation of all the synchronization, communication & coordination primitives required in popt4jlib.
    parallel.distributed
    Extends the basic functionality found in the parallel package over many remote JVMs distributed over a network of machines.
    popt4jlib
    popt4jlib: a parallel optimization library for Java.
    popt4jlib.GA
    Genetic Algorithms Parallel Implementation.
    popt4jlib.GradientDescent
    Gradient-Descent Type Algorithms Parallel Implementation (suitable for real vector function optimization).
    popt4jlib.MSSC
    Package implements algorithms for Minimum-Sum-of-Square(-Errors)-Clustering, a well-defined optimization problem.
    popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning
    Package defines parallel/distributed versions of well-known Number Partitioning algorithms.
    tests
    tests package: defines functions used for testing the optimization algorithms in the popt4jlib library.
    utils
    utils package: containing useful classes and methods including I/O manipulation.
  • Classes in parallel used by analysis 
    Class and Description
    ParallelException 
    TaskObject
    interface defining what a TaskObject must support.
  • Classes in parallel used by graph 
    Class and Description
    ConditionCounter
    implements a "condition" counter, so that when the object's counter reaches a specified number, it releases a notification for any waiting thread to resume execution.
    DMCoordinator
    Title: Thread Coordination Management System
    FasterParallelAsynchBatchTaskExecutor
    A faster class that implements thread-pooling to allow its users to execute concurrently a batch of tasks implementing the TaskObject, or more simply, the Runnable interface.
    ParallelException 
    TaskObject
    interface defining what a TaskObject must support.
  • Classes in parallel used by graph.coarsening 
    Class and Description
    ParallelException 
  • Classes in parallel used by graph.packing 
    Class and Description
    ConditionCounter
    implements a "condition" counter, so that when the object's counter reaches a specified number, it releases a notification for any waiting thread to resume execution.
    FasterParallelAsynchBatchTaskExecutor
    A faster class that implements thread-pooling to allow its users to execute concurrently a batch of tasks implementing the TaskObject, or more simply, the Runnable interface.
    ParallelException 
    TaskObject
    interface defining what a TaskObject must support.
  • Classes in parallel used by graph.partitioning 
    Class and Description
    ParallelException 
  • Classes in parallel used by parallel 
    Class and Description
    Barrier
    A class implementing the Barrier concept in parallel/distributed computing.
    BlockingFasterMsgPassingCoordinator
    The BlockingFasterMsgPassingCoordinator class is yet another class that implements the rendevouz mechanism in parallel programming.
    BlockingMsgPassingCoordinator
    The BlockingMsgPassingCoordinator class is yet another Singleton class that implements the rendevouz mechanism in parallel programming.
    BoundedBufferArrayUnsynchronized
    a bounded-length FIFO buffer implemented as an Object Array that is totally unsynchronized.
    ComparableTaskObject
    empty interface for use with dynamic, priority-based task msg-passing coordinators and executors.
    ComplexBarrier
    A class implementing the Barrier concept in parallel/distributed computing.
    DATE2Test.Fib 
    DATE3Test.Fib 
    DLCListNode 
    DMCoordinator
    Title: Thread Coordination Management System
    DMCT2LThread 
    DMCTest2
    class simulates the data access synchronization processes in AMORE (AIT MOvie Recommendation Engine).
    DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor
    A faster class that implements thread-pooling to allow its users to execute concurrently tasks implementing the Runnable interface.
    DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor2
    an enhancement over DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor in that it augments its threads in its thread-pool with two local queues so that they first look for tasks in their "hot" local queue, then if no task is in the global queue either available for execution, they finally go into the "cold" queue.
    DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3
    Exactly the same as DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor2 class, only that the thread-pool's threads' hot local queue is also unbounded (as is the cold local queue), as is the global shared queue, so that all associated queues are unbounded, and therefore do not act as "synchronizers" between the executor threads (see Brian Goetz et al "Java Concurrency in Practice").
    FairDMCoordinator
    Title: Thread Coordination Management System
    FasterParallelAsynchBatchPriorityTaskExecutor
    A faster class that implements thread-pooling to allow its users to execute concurrently batch of tasks implementing the ComparableTaskObject interface (or the extending interface, ThreadSpecificComparableTaskObject encapsulating the requirement that the task be run on a thread with a particular thread-id).
    FasterParallelAsynchBatchTaskExecutor
    A faster class that implements thread-pooling to allow its users to execute concurrently a batch of tasks implementing the TaskObject, or more simply, the Runnable interface.
    FPABPTEThread
    helper class for FasterParallelAsynchBatchPriorityTaskExecutor.
    FPABTEThread
    helper class for FasterParallelAsynchBatchTaskExecutor.
    Lock
    Standard Lock mechanism for thread coordination.
    MsgPassingCoordinator
    The MsgPassingCoordinator class is yet another class that allows sending and receiving (synchronous and asynchronous) data between threads.
    OrderedBarrier
    Title: popt4jlib
    PABTEThread
    helper class for ParallelAsynchBatchTaskExecutor.
    ParallelAsynchBatchTaskExecutor
    A class that implements thread-pooling to allow its users to execute concurrently a batch of tasks implementing the TaskObject, or more simply, the Runnable interface.
    ParallelBatchTaskExecutor
    A class that implements thread-pooling to allow its users to execute concurrently a batch of tasks implementing the TaskObject, or more simply, the Runnable interface.
    ParallelException 
    ParallelExceptionUnsubmittedTasks
    encapsulates any unsubmitted tasks to executors.
    PBTEThread 
    RegisteredParcel
    This is an auxiliary helper class for the *MsgPassingCoordinator classes.
    RegisteredParcelPool
    The class is responsible for maintaining a sufficiently large array of RegisteredParcel objects, and there will be a pool for each thread of execution.
    Semaphore
    Class implementing the classical notion of Semaphores as "permits".
    SFMPCOld 
    SimpleFasterMsgPassingCoordinator
    The SimpleFasterMsgPassingCoordinator class is yet another class that allows sending and receiving (synchronous and asynchronous) data between threads.
    SimplePriorityMsgPassingCoordinator
    The SimplePriorityMsgPassingCoordinator class: yet another class that allows sending and receiving (synchronous and asynchronous) data between threads.
    SingleQueue 
    TaskObject
    interface defining what a TaskObject must support.
    ThreadSpecificTaskObject
    interface indicates that a specific Runnable must be run on a thread with the specified thread-id (or any thread, or any thread except a specific one).
    UnboundedBufferArrayUnsynchronized
    an unbounded-length FIFO buffer implemented as an Object Array that's totally unsynchronized.
    UnboundedSimpleFasterMsgPassingCoordinator
    Exactly the same as SimpleFasterMsgPassingCoordinator except that its queue is unbounded, and therefore cannot throw ParallelException in cases where having a full queue would throw.
    WaitObject

  • Classes in parallel used by popt4jlib 
    Class and Description
    DMCoordinator
    Title: Thread Coordination Management System
    LimitedTimeTaskExecutor
    A class that allows its users to execute tasks (object that describe some computation that must implement the TaskObject interface) for a limited time, starting them in different threads than the thread that called the execute(task) method.

  • Classes in parallel used by popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning 
    Class and Description
    ComparableTaskObject
    empty interface for use with dynamic, priority-based task msg-passing coordinators and executors.
    DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor3
    Exactly the same as DynamicAsynchTaskExecutor2 class, only that the thread-pool's threads' hot local queue is also unbounded (as is the cold local queue), as is the global shared queue, so that all associated queues are unbounded, and therefore do not act as "synchronizers" between the executor threads (see Brian Goetz et al "Java Concurrency in Practice").
    FasterParallelAsynchBatchPriorityTaskExecutor
    A faster class that implements thread-pooling to allow its users to execute concurrently batch of tasks implementing the ComparableTaskObject interface (or the extending interface, ThreadSpecificComparableTaskObject encapsulating the requirement that the task be run on a thread with a particular thread-id).
    ParallelException 
    TaskObject
    interface defining what a TaskObject must support.
    ThreadSpecificComparableTaskObject
    interface for use with dynamic, priority-based task msg-passing coordinators and executors.
    ThreadSpecificTaskObject
    interface indicates that a specific Runnable must be run on a thread with the specified thread-id (or any thread, or any thread except a specific one).
